text:
If you have a simple cgi script "Hello world" and you wants to start this 
script with parameters (e.g. http://www.domain.com/script.cgi?parameter=ä), 
Apache generates an :
couldn't create child process: 20508: C:/Programme/Apache/Apache2/cgi-
bin/test.pl 
I tried the same with Apache 1.3.24 and there, this problem does not exist.

The problem only exists if you have parameters like ä,ö,ü,à,á,ß. If you use 
a,o,u,... there is no problem. But for international sites, you need all 
characters!
This problem also does not exist if you have text-fields within a <form> 
because the characters will be converted to "%E4", ...

Here the cgi-script:
#!c:/perl/bin/perl
print "Content-type: text/html; charset=ISO-8859-1\n\n";
print "Hello World!!";
creator: norbert.goepel@ec-munich.com

text:
In general, unescape non-US-ASCII characters are not allowed in URLs.
You should be URL-escaping characters before putting them in a query
string.

But I'll leave this open for now, since we may want to allow this anyway,
and the error mesage is certainly uninformative.
creator: slive@apache.org
